identity.mission: Create a campus lost and found system that feels like a high-end academic tool, not a generic template. Prioritize clarity, trust, and efficiency.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix 'Swiss Poster' precision with 'Utility App' speed.
Emotion First: Reduce anxiety for lost items; Celebrate relief for found items.
Content is King: The item photo is the hero. Details are secondary.
Zoom In: Use large, clear thumbnails for items.
Negative Space: Don't clutter. Use whitespace to separate distinct actions.

theme.name: Academic Authority
theme.description: Objective, rigid, functional. Color exists only to guide action.

headings.usage: All page titles, section headers, and modal titles. Do NOT use Inter for headings.

primary.name: Academic Slate
primary.usage: Primary buttons, active states, navigation bars.

visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle noise overlay on the public landing page hero section only.
visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use backdrop-blur-md for sticky headers and modal overlays.

public_display.description: Asymmetrical grid for 'Found' items to catch attention. Large hero image of the campus.

student_dashboard.description: Single column cards. Large touch targets. Bottom navigation on mobile.

admin_dashboard.description: High density. Sidebar navigation. Data tables with sticky headers.

buttons.style: Sharp corners or slightly rounded (md). No pill shapes.

cards.style: Flat with 1px border. No shadow by default. Shadow on hover.
cards.content: Image takes up 50% of card height in grid view.

inputs.style: Shadcn default with slate-200 border. Focus ring: slate-900.

tables.style: Compact. Zebra striping optional. Row hover effect mandatory.

modals.style: Clean white background. No heavy gradients. Clear 'Close' action.

instructions_to_main_agent: Use 'Outfit' font for all headings. Import it from Google Fonts.
Ensure the college name 'ST. PETERS COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING AND TECHNOLOGY' is visible in the header at all times.
For the Public Display page, use a read-only view with a large search bar.
Student Login must use 'Roll Number' and 'DOB' fields, not email/password.
Admin Dashboard must use a Sidebar layout.
Use the defined color palette strictly. Do not introduce new colors.
Implement 'Soft Delete' logic in the backend, but visually show 'Deleted' items in a separate Admin tab with a distinct style (e.g., opacity 0.5).
AI Match Suggestions should be a distinct UI section in the Admin Item Detail view.
All interactive elements must have data-testid attributes.
universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for backgrounds. Use solid colors or subtle noise.
Use 2-3x more spacing than typical designs.
